entries.name: def_single_delegator(accessor, method, new_name=method)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Defines a method method which delegates to accessor (i.e. it calls the method of the same name in accessor).  If new_name is provided, it is used as the name for the delegate method. Returns the name of the method defined.

entries.name: def_single_delegators(accessor, *methods)
entries.desc: Shortcut for defining multiple delegator methods, but with no provision for using a different name.  The following two code samples have the same effect:
